definition[0]: something such as a piece of equipment or a decoration that is not necessary, but that makes a machine, car, room etc more useful or more attractive
example[0]: bathroom accessories such as mirrors and towel-rails
definition[1]: something such as a bag, belt, or jewellery that you wear or carry because it is attractive
example[2]: a set of fully matching clothes and accessories
definition[2]: someone who helps a criminal, especially by helping them hide from the police
note[0]: an accessory before/after the fact (=someone who helps a criminal before or after the crime)
definition[3]: something that you add to a machine, tool, car etc so that it can do other things or in order to make it look attractive
example[4]: They sell software and computer accessories.
example[5]: a manufacturer of motor vehicle parts and accessories
definition[4]: small things that are used for a particular activity
example[6]: a retail chain that sells cooking items, kitchen accessories and home furnishings
example[7]: a maker of plastic folders, binders and other office accessories
definition[5]: someone who helps a criminal, but is not directly involved in a crime
example[8]: He was an accessory to murder.
